note.p: Death: St Alban Hall, Oxford (08 March 1825)
Education: Westminster School; Oxford. MA (1797), DD

Career: Took Holy Orders; inherited a fortume from his uncle, leaving him time for private study; lived in Edinburgh and wrote on classical subjects for the Edinburgh Review; lived in London, then went to St Mary Cray; visited Italy and Germany; Principal, St Alban's Hall, Oxford; Camden Professor of Ancient History, Oxford
References: J M Edmonds and J A Douglas, 'William Buckland, FRS (1784-1856) and an Oxford Geological Lecture, 1823' in NR 1975-6 vol 30 pp 141-167
